events.title: Patrick Henry's 'Give me liberty, or give me death!' speech
events.description: Patrick Henry delivered his famous speech to the Virginia Convention, urging the colonies to take up arms against British rule, marking a pivotal moment in the American Revolution.
events.significance: This speech galvanized colonial opposition to British rule and helped propel the American colonies towards revolutionary war.

events.title: Lewis and Clark Expedition returns
events.description: Meriwether Lewis and William Clark led the Corps of Discovery back to St. Louis after exploring the newly acquired Louisiana Territory, completing their journey to the Pacific Ocean and back.
events.significance: The expedition provided valuable information about the geography, biology, and indigenous peoples of the western United States.

events.title: Founding of the Italian Fascist Party
events.description: Benito Mussolini founded the Fasci Italiani di Combattimento, the forerunner of the National Fascist Party, marking the birth of fascism in Italy.
events.significance: This event heralded the rise of fascism and significantly impacted European and world political history in the 20th century.

events.title: Civil Rights Movement: The first Selma to Montgomery march begins
events.description: After 'Bloody Sunday', approximately 3,200 civil rights activists began the march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, to demand voting rights for African Americans.
events.significance: The march increased national awareness of racial injustice and helped lead to the passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

events.title: Introduction of the first Internet domain name system (DNS)
events.description: The Domain Name System (DNS), a key component in the functioning of the Internet, was implemented for the first time, allowing users to access websites using user-friendly domain names instead of IP addresses.
events.significance: The DNS revolutionized the usability of the internet and laid the foundation for its rapid expansion and global accessibility.
